metadata.Title: CVE-2023-21255 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In multiple functions of binder.c, there is a possible memory corruption due to a use after free. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation. Zi Fan Tan discovered that the binder IPC implementation in the Linux kernel contained a use-after-free vulnerability. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-21255` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.2.0-32-generic - 6.2.0-32.32
linux-image-6.2.0-32-generic-lpae - 6.2.0-32.32
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-32-generic - 6.2.0-32.32
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-32-generic-64k - 6.2.0-32.32
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1011-aws - 6.2.0-1011.11
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-32.32').
linux-allwinner: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of life, was needs-triage').
